thread.title: Massage therapist in Kirkwood charged with sexual misconduct
thread.title_full: Massage therapist in Kirkwood charged with sexual misconduct

author: Kim Bell â€¢ St. Louis Post-Dispatch
title: Massage therapist in Kirkwood charged with sexual misconduct
text:
Jason Deal 
A man working as a massage therapist in Kirkwood was charged Friday with sexual misconduct. 
Jason Deal, 34, faces two counts of second-degree sexual assault. The charges stem from incidents involving two adult female customers. Court records do not identify the business but give its address as 200 South Kirkwood Road. 
One of the alleged crimes happened last Dec. 19, the other on Tuesday. The charges are misdemeanors. 
The charges allege that Deal "solicited" the women to "engage in sexual conduct under circumstances in which he knew that such solicitation was likely to cause affront or alarm." 
St. Louis County prosecutors filed the charges Friday, and a judge set bail at $2,000. The level of misdemeanor Deal is charged with is punishable in Missouri by up to 15 days in jail and a $300 fine. 
According to court records, Deal was giving a woman a massage when he moved his hands toward her underwear line, asking "Is this OK?" At first she indicated it was alright, because she thought it was part of the massage, police say. But she soon realized it was a sexual advance and said "no." Something similar happened to the second woman, who told police she was shocked and afraid. 
Deal lives in the 1200 block of Covington Manor Lane in unincorporated St. Louis County. Police say he admitted to the sexual contact. 
Police are asking anyone who has a similar complaint against Deal to contact Det. Jennifer Burton at 314-984-6902 or the Kirkwood Police Department at 314-822-5858.
